name: the one where Ricardo tries to register a new owner using the clinic API with an existing owner
scenarioId: classpath:features/owners/owners_registration:the one where Ricardo tries to register a new owner using the clinic API with an existing owner
methodName: the one where Ricardo tries to register a new owner using the clinic API with an existing owner

testSteps.description:
Given Ricardo has already registered an owner with the following information
| firstName | lastName | address | city | phone |
| Peter | Anderson | nassaukade 161-2 | Amsterdam | 0629416321 |

children.description: Ricardo registers a new Owner using the API
Ricardo executes a POST on the resource /owners

testSteps.description: When Kelly sends a registration request using the clinic API with the same data used by Ricardo

children.description: Kelly registers a new Owner using the API
Kelly executes a POST on the resource /owners

testSteps.description: Then the system should return a 400 response code

children.description: For Kelly: Then the response status should be (400)

testSteps.description: And the response body should include the error with code AlreadyExists and field owner

userStory.storyName: The Pet Clinic should allow to register a pet owner in the system
userStory.displayName: The Pet Clinic should allow to register a pet owner in the system
userStory.narrative:
As a VetClinic Manager
  I would like to be able to register a new owner in the system
  In order to handle all the pets and visits made by him

title: the one where Ricardo tries to register a new owner using the clinic API with an existing owner

rule.name: The system should not allow to register an owner with same personal information of an existing owner

testFailureCause.message:
The following 2 assertions failed:
1) Expected: <400>
     but: was <201>
2) Expected: <400>
     but: was <201>
